discussion.content:
to understand the solution see this article 
https://www.techrepublic.com/article/use-a-post-card-to-save-time-when-troubleshooting-failed-hardware/

questions.question_text: A brownout has occurred within a building. A technician is repairing a workstation which has a power light, but is not displaying anything on the screen and is not making any sounds during boot up. Which of the following should be used to further troubleshoot the workstation?

discussion.content: An on-screen display (OSD) is a control panel on a computer monitor or television screen that allows you to select viewing options and/or adjust components of the display, such as brightness, contrast, and horizontal and vertical positioning.

questions.question_text: A user is reporting that a desktop monitor backlighting is very dim. Which of the following should be performed FIRST when troubleshooting the problem?

A user notices the printer that is used for printing global shippers labels is missing columns in the printed labels. The special label stock is new and appears to be fine. Which of the following should the technician perform FIRST when troubleshooting this problem?

choices.C: Clean the print head with approved materials
choices.B: Clean the pickup rollers and check them for wear
choices.A: Remove any stuck labels from the paper path
choices.D: Replace and realign the print head

questions.question_text: An office printer that was working earlier in the day is no longer printing any documents. Pre-existing workstations are manually configured to print to the printer directly over the network. A technician has started to troubleshoot the problem and determines that the printer can still be seen in the network directory. The technician has also verified that the printer can print self-diagnostic pages successfully. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause of the problem?

discussion.content: The printer is working by DHCP on the network , so you have to change the printer IP from DHCP to Static or do IP reservation in the DHCP configuration.
Printer IP is set to static as it is a service device so it cannot be answer A
If printer can be seen I guess his IP is still same?

choices.B: The network print spooler service has been restarted.
choices.C: "Perform Printer Maintenance" message is displayed on the printer’s LCD panel.
choices.A: The printer's IP address has changed.
choices.D: Two or more users sent print jobs simultaneously, causing a print collision.

choices.B: The PC’s RAM was affected by ESD.
choices.C: The power supply was damaged and is nonfunctional.
choices.D: The hard drive was erased due to the power test.
choices.A: The motherboard was damaged by the power test.

discussion.content: (there is no output display or POST beep codes) and (the fan is working means there is no problem in the power supply ) so the problem is damaged motherboard

questions.question_text:
A technician receives a call that a clients PC is not booting after a recent test of the buildings back-up generators. When the technician arrives, it is discovered that, once powered on, there is no output display or POST beep codes. Furthermore, after 15 seconds, the systems fans begin running much louder and faster.
Which of the following is the MOST likely issue?
